com.camerontec.catalys.util.task

Interface ITask

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IControlledTask
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlockAndStopTask, BlockTask, CompactTask, ControlledTaskBase, EndOfDayTask, MonitoredTaskController, PartyTaskBase, ResetTask, ShutdownTask, StartTask, StopTask, Task, TaskBase, TechnologyAdapterBase.PolledPeerReaderTask, UnblockAndStartTask, UnblockTask

    public interface ITask
extends Runnable
    Interface of any object that can be "run". A task can also have attributes which are normally set before it is run.

    This is our version of the well known Command design pattern as described in, for example, "Design Patterns" by Gamma, Helm, Johnson and Vlissides, Addison Wesley, 1995.

    Note that our equivalent of the "Execute" method as describe in Gamma at al is the "run" method. This has the added advantage of making our tasks Runnable objects.

    Using tasks as separate objects like this has the following advantages:

    • It naturally fits with GUI actions triggered by menus, buttons etc.
    • It allows for complex tasks to be defined once then reused.
    • It decouples the details of task execution from the details of how a task was triggered (eg from a menu, button, scheduled event etc).
    • It naturally allows for permissions by task.
    • Allows for the possibility of undo in the future (by saving the task objects - each task can contain all the information required to perform undo itself).

    For example, ITask objects are used in the util.schedule package as the basic scheduled task. They are also used in our monitoring option as actions associated with user interface elements.

        void setAttributes(Map<String,Object> attributes)
